awd_titl_txt: Mathematical Sciences:  Topics in the Representation Theory of Finite Groups
awd_abstract_narration: This research is concerned with the representation theory of               finite groups and group cohomology.  The principal investigator                 will work on Mackey functors; Alperin's conjecture; the                         development of computer software; group cohomology calculations;                stable summands of classifying spaces; and perfect isometries of                blocks and derived equivalences.                                                     The research supported concerns the representation theory of               finite groups.  A group is an algebraic object used to study                    transformations.  Because of this, groups are a fundamental tool                in physics, chemistry and computer science as well as                           mathematics.  Representation theory is an important method for                  determining the structure of groups.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences
